'''''Mythlore'' 40''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol11/iss2/ Volume 11, Issue 2]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].
==Contents==

====Articles====

* Kollmann, Judith. “Charles Williams and Second-Hand Paganism.”
* Ryan, J. S. “Uncouth Innocence: Some Links Between Chrétien de Troyes, Wolfram von Eschenbach and J.R.R. Tolkien.”
* Filmer, Kath. “Speaking in Parables.”
* Slethaug, Gordon E. “No Exit: The Hero as Victim in Donaldson.”
* Rawls, Melanie. “The Rings of Power.”
* Patterson, Nancy-Lou. “Halfe Like A Serpent: The Green Witch in The Silver Chair.”

====Poetry====

*Kocher, Paul. “The High King of England.”

====Features====

* GoodKnight, Glen H. Editor's Opening.
* Thompson, George H. Early Review of Books by J.R.R. Tolkien.
* Bratman, David S. Subject Index to Mythlore Issues 31-39.
* Hyde, Paul Nolan. “Quenti Lambardillion."
* Beach, Sarah. “Mythopoesis.”
* Letters.

====Reviews====

* ''J.R.R. Tolkien: This Far Land.'' Robert Giddings. Reviewed by Jessica Yates.
* ''The Book of Lost Tales Part II.'' J.R.R. Tolkien. Reviewed by Sarah Beach.
* ''The Monsters and the Critics, and Other Essays.'' J.R.R. Tolkien. Reviewed by Thomas M. Egan.
* ''The Restitution of Man: C.S. Lewis and the Case Against Scientism.'' Michael D. Aeschliman. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''The High Kings: Arthur's Celtic Ancestors.'' Joy Chant. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
